alert.note: Alert for Lee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 7:09AM EDT until June 04 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 7.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, Bonita Springs, Lehigh Acres, McGregor, Cypress Lake, Pine Manor, Villas, Harlem Heights, Iona, Lochmoor Waterway Estates, East Dunbar, San Carlos Park, Palmona Park, Three Oaks, Southwest Florida Airport, Lovers Key State Park, Matlacha Isles-Matlacha Shores, Matlacha and Buckingham. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
